017package org.apache.juneau.commons.collections;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.AssertionUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.Utils.*;
022
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025
026/**
027 * A map wrapper that filters entries based on a {@link BiPredicate} when they are added.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * This class wraps an underlying map and applies a filter to determine whether entries should be added.
031 * Only entries that pass the filter (i.e., the predicate returns <jk>true</jk>) are actually stored in
032 * the underlying map.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>Features:</h5>
035 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
036 *    <li><b>Flexible Filtering:</b> Use any {@link BiPredicate} to filter entries based on key, value, or both
037 *    <li><b>Optional Filter:</b> Filter is optional when using the builder - defaults to accepting all entries
038 *    <li><b>Multiple Filters:</b> Can combine multiple filters using AND logic
039 *    <li><b>Custom Map Types:</b> Works with any map implementation via the builder's <c>inner</c> method
040 *    <li><b>Type Conversion:</b> Supports automatic type conversion via key/value functions
041 *    <li><b>Convenience Methods:</b> Provides {@link #add(Object, Object)}, {@link #addAll(Map)}, {@link #addAny(Object...)}, and {@link #addPairs(Object...)} for easy entry addition
042 *    <li><b>Transparent Interface:</b> Implements the full {@link Map} interface, so it can be used anywhere a map is expected
043 *    <li><b>Filter on Add:</b> Filtering happens when entries are added via {@link #put(Object, Object)}, {@link #putAll(Map)}, etc.
044 * </ul>
045 *
046 * <h5 class='section'>Usage:</h5>
047 * <p class='bjava'>
048 *    <jc>// Create a filtered map that only accepts non-null values</jc>
049 *    FilteredMap&lt;String, String&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
050 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>)
051 *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>)
052 *       .build();
053 *
054 *    <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"key1"</js>, <js>"value1"</js>);  <jc>// Added</jc>
055 *    <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"key2"</js>, <jk>null</jk>);      <jc>// Filtered out</jc>
056 *    <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"key3"</js>, <js>"value3"</js>);  <jc>// Added</jc>
057 *
058 *    <jc>// map now contains: {"key1"="value1", "key3"="value3"}</jc>
059 * </p>
060 *
061 * <h5 class='section'>Example - Custom Map Type:</h5>
062 * <p class='bjava'>
063 *    <jc>// Create a filtered TreeMap that only accepts positive values</jc>
064 *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
065 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
066 *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
067 *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> TreeMap&lt;&gt;())
068 *       .build();
069 *
070 *    <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"a"</js>, 5);   <jc>// Added</jc>
071 *    <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"b"</js>, -1);  <jc>// Filtered out</jc>
072 *    <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"c"</js>, 10);  <jc>// Added</jc>
073 * </p>
074 *
075 * <h5 class='section'>Behavior Notes:</h5>
076 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
077 *    <li>Filtering is applied to all entry addition methods: {@link #put(Object, Object)}, {@link #putAll(Map)}, etc.
078 *    <li>If the filter returns <jk>false</jk>, the entry is silently ignored (not added)
079 *    <li>When {@link #put(Object, Object)} filters out an entry, it returns the previous value associated with the key
080 *       (if any), or <jk>null</jk> if the key did not exist. This allows callers to distinguish between a new entry
081 *       being filtered out versus an existing entry being filtered out.
082 *    <li>The filter is not applied when reading from the map (e.g., {@link #get(Object)}, {@link #containsKey(Object)})
083 *    <li>All other map operations behave as expected on the underlying map
084 *    <li>The underlying map type is determined by the <c>inner</c> method (defaults to {@link LinkedHashMap})
085 * </ul>
086 *
087 * <h5 class='section'>Thread Safety:</h5>
088 * <p>
089 * This class is not thread-safe unless the underlying map is thread-safe. If thread safety is required,
090 * use a thread-safe map type (e.g., {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap}) via the <c>inner</c> method.
091 *
092 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5>
093 * <ul>
094 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#juneau-commons">Overview &gt; juneau-commons</a>
095 * </ul>
096 *
097 * @param <K> The key type.
098 * @param <V> The value type.
099 */
100public class FilteredMap<K,V> extends AbstractMap<K,V> {
101
102   /**
103    * Builder for creating {@link FilteredMap} instances.
104    *
105    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
106    * <p class='bjava'>
107    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
108    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
109    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
110    *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> TreeMap&lt;&gt;())
111    *       .build();
112    * </p>
113    *
114    * @param <K> The key type.
115    * @param <V> The value type.
116    */
117   public static class Builder<K,V> {
118      private BiPredicate<K,V> filter = (k,v) -> true;
119      private Map<K,V> inner;
120      private Class<K> keyType;
121      private Class<V> valueType;
122      private Function<Object,K> keyFunction;
123      private Function<Object,V> valueFunction;
124
125      /**
126       * Sets the filter predicate that determines whether entries should be added.
127       *
128       * <p>
129       * The predicate receives both the key and value of each entry. If it returns <jk>true</jk>,
130       * the entry is added to the map. If it returns <jk>false</jk>, the entry is silently ignored.
131       *
132       * <p>
133       * This method is optional. If not called, the map will accept all entries (defaults to <c>(k,v) -&gt; true</c>).
134       *
135       * <p>
136       * This method can be called multiple times. When called multiple times, all filters are combined
137       * using AND logic - an entry must pass all filters to be added to the map.
138       *
139       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
140       * <p class='bjava'>
141       *    <jc>// Filter out null values</jc>
142       *    Builder&lt;String, String&gt; <jv>b</jv> = FilteredMap.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>)
143       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>);
144       *
145       *    <jc>// Filter based on both key and value</jc>
146       *    Builder&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>b2</jv> = FilteredMap.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
147       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; ! k.startsWith(<js>"_"</js>) &amp;&amp; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0);
148       *
149       *    <jc>// Multiple filters combined with AND</jc>
150       *    Builder&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>b3</jv> = FilteredMap.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
151       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>)           <jc>// First filter</jc>
152       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v &gt; 0)                    <jc>// Second filter (ANDed with first)</jc>
153       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; ! k.startsWith(<js>"_"</js>)); <jc>// Third filter (ANDed with previous)</jc>
154       * </p>
155       *
156       * @param value The filter predicate. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
157       * @return This object for method chaining.
158       */
159      public Builder<K,V> filter(BiPredicate<K,V> value) {
160         BiPredicate<K,V> newFilter = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
161         if (filter == null)
162            filter = newFilter;
163         else
164            filter = filter.and(newFilter);
165         return this;
166      }
167
168      /**
169       * Sets the underlying map instance that will store the filtered entries.
170       *
171       * <p>
172       * If not specified, a new {@link LinkedHashMap} will be created during {@link #build()}.
173       *
174       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
175       * <p class='bjava'>
176       *    <jc>// Use a TreeMap for sorted keys</jc>
177       *    Builder&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>b</jv> = FilteredMap.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
178       *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> TreeMap&lt;&gt;());
179       *
180       *    <jc>// Use a ConcurrentHashMap for thread safety</jc>
181       *    Builder&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>b2</jv> = FilteredMap.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
182       *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> ConcurrentHashMap&lt;&gt;());
183       *
184       *    <jc>// Use an existing map</jc>
185       *    Map&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>existing</jv> = <jk>new</jk> LinkedHashMap&lt;&gt;();
186       *    Builder&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>b3</jv> = FilteredMap.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
187       *       .inner(<jv>existing</jv>);
188       * </p>
189       *
190       * @param value The underlying map instance. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
191       * @return This object for method chaining.
192       */
193      public Builder<K,V> inner(Map<K,V> value) {
194         inner = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
195         return this;
196      }
197
198      /**
199       * Sets the function to use for converting keys when using {@link FilteredMap#add(Object, Object)}.
200       *
201       * <p>
202       * If specified, keys passed to {@link FilteredMap#add(Object, Object)} will be converted using
203       * this function before being added to the map. If not specified, keys must already be of the
204       * correct type (or <c>Object.class</c> is used if types were not specified, which accepts any type).
205       *
206       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
207       * <p class='bjava'>
208       *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
209       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
210       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>)
211       *       .keyFunction(o -&gt; o.toString())
212       *       .build();
213       *
214       *    <jv>map</jv>.add(123, 5);  <jc>// Key will be converted from Integer to String</jc>
215       * </p>
216       *
217       * @param value The key conversion function. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
218       * @return This object for method chaining.
219       */
220      public Builder<K,V> keyFunction(Function<Object,K> value) {
221         keyFunction = value;
222         return this;
223      }
224
225      /**
226       * Sets the function to use for converting values when using {@link FilteredMap#add(Object, Object)}.
227       *
228       * <p>
229       * If specified, values passed to {@link FilteredMap#add(Object, Object)} will be converted using
230       * this function before being added to the map. If not specified, values must already be of the
231       * correct type (or <c>Object.class</c> is used if types were not specified, which accepts any type).
232       *
233       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
234       * <p class='bjava'>
235       *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
236       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
237       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
238       *       .valueFunction(o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString()))
239       *       .build();
240       *
241       *    <jv>map</jv>.add(<js>"key"</js>, <js>"123"</js>);  <jc>// Value will be converted from String to Integer</jc>
242       * </p>
243       *
244       * @param value The value conversion function. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
245       * @return This object for method chaining.
246       */
247      public Builder<K,V> valueFunction(Function<Object,V> value) {
248         valueFunction = value;
249         return this;
250      }
251
252      /**
253       * Sets both the key and value conversion functions at once.
254       *
255       * <p>
256       * This is a convenience method for setting both conversion functions in a single call.
257       *
258       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
259       * <p class='bjava'>
260       *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
261       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
262       *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
263       *       .functions(
264       *          o -&gt; o.toString(),                    <jc>// Key function</jc>
265       *          o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString())   <jc>// Value function</jc>
266       *       )
267       *       .build();
268       * </p>
269       *
270       * @param keyFunction The key conversion function. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
271       * @param valueFunction The value conversion function. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
272       * @return This object for method chaining.
273       */
274      public Builder<K,V> functions(Function<Object,K> keyFunction, Function<Object,V> valueFunction) {
275         this.keyFunction = keyFunction;
276         this.valueFunction = valueFunction;
277         return this;
278      }
279
280      /**
281       * Builds a new {@link FilteredMap} instance.
282       *
283       * <p>
284       * If {@link #filter(BiPredicate)} was not called, the map will accept all entries
285       * (defaults to <c>(k,v) -&gt; true</c>).
286       *
287       * @return A new filtered map instance.
288       */
289      public FilteredMap<K,V> build() {
290         Map<K,V> map = inner != null ? inner : new LinkedHashMap<>();
291         return new FilteredMap<>(filter, map, keyType, valueType, keyFunction, valueFunction);
292      }
293   }
294
295   /**
296    * Creates a new builder for constructing a filtered map.
297    *
298    * @param <K> The key type.
299    * @param <V> The value type.
300    * @param keyType The key type class. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
301    * @param valueType The value type class. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
302    * @return A new builder.
303    */
304   public static <K,V> Builder<K,V> create(Class<K> keyType, Class<V> valueType) {
305      assertArgNotNull("keyType", keyType);
306      assertArgNotNull("valueType", valueType);
307      var builder = new Builder<K,V>();
308      builder.keyType = keyType;
309      builder.valueType = valueType;
310      return builder;
311   }
312
313   /**
314    * Creates a new builder for constructing a filtered map with generic types.
315    *
316    * <p>
317    * This is a convenience method that creates a builder without requiring explicit type class parameters.
318    * The generic types must be explicitly specified using the diamond operator syntax.
319    *
320    * <p>
321    * When using this method, type checking is effectively disabled (using <c>Object.class</c> as the type),
322    * allowing any key and value types to be added. However, the generic type parameters should still be
323    * specified for type safety.
324    *
325    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
326    * <p class='bjava'>
327    *    <jc>// Explicitly specify generic types using diamond operator</jc>
328    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
329    *       .&lt;String, String&gt;<jsm>create</jsm>()
330    *       .filter((<jv>k</jv>, <jv>v</jv>) -&gt; <jv>v</jv> != <jk>null</jk>)
331    *       .build();
332    * </p>
333    *
334    * @param <K> The key type.
335    * @param <V> The value type.
336    * @return A new builder.
337    */
338   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
339   public static <K,V> Builder<K,V> create() {
340      var builder = new Builder<K,V>();
341      builder.keyType = (Class<K>)Object.class;
342      builder.valueType = (Class<V>)Object.class;
343      return builder;
344   }
345   private final BiPredicate<K,V> filter;
346   private final Map<K,V> map;
347   private final Class<K> keyType;
348   private final Class<V> valueType;
349   private final Function<Object,K> keyFunction;
350   private final Function<Object,V> valueFunction;
351
352   /**
353    * Constructor.
354    *
355    * @param filter The filter predicate. Can be <jk>null</jk> (if null, all entries are accepted).
356    * @param map The underlying map. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
357    * @param keyType The key type. Must not be <jk>null</jk> (use <c>Object.class</c> to disable type checking).
358    * @param valueType The value type. Must not be <jk>null</jk> (use <c>Object.class</c> to disable type checking).
359    * @param keyFunction The key conversion function, or <jk>null</jk> if not specified.
360    * @param valueFunction The value conversion function, or <jk>null</jk> if not specified.
361    */
362   protected FilteredMap(BiPredicate<K,V> filter, Map<K,V> map, Class<K> keyType, Class<V> valueType, Function<Object,K> keyFunction, Function<Object,V> valueFunction) {
363      this.filter = assertArgNotNull("filter", filter);
364      this.map = assertArgNotNull("map", map);
365      this.keyType = assertArgNotNull("keyType", keyType);
366      this.valueType = assertArgNotNull("valueType", valueType);
367      this.keyFunction = keyFunction;
368      this.valueFunction = valueFunction;
369   }
370
371   /**
372    * Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map, if the entry passes the filter.
373    *
374    * <p>
375    * If the entry passes the filter, it is added to the map and this method returns the previous value
376    * associated with the key (or <jk>null</jk> if there was no mapping).
377    *
378    * <p>
379    * If the entry is filtered out, it is not added to the map. This method returns the previous value
380    * associated with the key (or <jk>null</jk> if there was no mapping). This allows callers to distinguish
381    * between a new entry being filtered out versus an existing entry being filtered out.
382    *
383    * @param key The key with which the specified value is to be associated.
384    * @param value The value to be associated with the specified key.
385    * @return The previous value associated with <c>key</c>, or <jk>null</jk> if there was no mapping for <c>key</c>.
386    *    This applies whether the entry was added or filtered out.
387    */
388   @Override
389   public V put(K key, V value) {
390      if (filter.test(key, value))
391         return map.put(key, value);
392      return map.get(key);  // Return previous value if exists, null otherwise
393   }
394
395   @Override
396   public void putAll(Map<? extends K, ? extends V> m) {
397      for (var entry : m.entrySet()) {
398         if (filter.test(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()))
399            map.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
400      }
401   }
402
403   /**
404    * Tests whether the specified key-value pair would pass the filter and be added to this map.
405    *
406    * <p>
407    * This method can be used to check if an entry would be accepted by the filter without actually
408    * adding it to the map. This is useful for validation, debugging, or pre-checking entries before
409    * attempting to add them.
410    *
411    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
412    * <p class='bjava'>
413    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
414    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
415    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
416    *       .build();
417    *
418    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>map</jv>.wouldAccept(<js>"key"</js>, 5)) {
419    *       <jv>map</jv>.put(<js>"key"</js>, 5);  <jc>// Will be added</jc>
420    *    }
421    * </p>
422    *
423    * @param key The key to test.
424    * @param value The value to test.
425    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entry would be added to the map, <jk>false</jk> if it would be filtered out.
426    */
427   public boolean wouldAccept(K key, V value) {
428      return filter.test(key, value);
429   }
430
431   /**
432    * Returns the filter predicate used by this map.
433    *
434    * <p>
435    * This method provides access to the filter for debugging, inspection, or advanced use cases.
436    * The returned predicate is the combined filter used internally by this map. If multiple filters
437    * were set via the builder, they are combined using AND logic.
438    *
439    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
440    * <p class='bjava'>
441    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
442    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
443    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
444    *       .build();
445    *
446    *    BiPredicate&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>filter</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.getFilter();
447    *    <jc>// Use filter for other purposes</jc>
448    * </p>
449    *
450    * @return The filter predicate. Never <jk>null</jk>.
451    */
452   public BiPredicate<K,V> getFilter() {
453      return filter;
454   }
455
456   @Override
457   public Set<Entry<K,V>> entrySet() {
458      return map.entrySet();
459   }
460
461   @Override
462   public V get(Object key) {
463      return map.get(key);
464   }
465
466   @Override
467   public V remove(Object key) {
468      return map.remove(key);
469   }
470
471   @Override
472   public boolean containsKey(Object key) {
473      return map.containsKey(key);
474   }
475
476   @Override
477   public boolean containsValue(Object value) {
478      return map.containsValue(value);
479   }
480
481   @Override
482   public int size() {
483      return map.size();
484   }
485
486   @Override
487   public boolean isEmpty() {
488      return map.isEmpty();
489   }
490
491   @Override
492   public void clear() {
493      map.clear();
494   }
495
496   @Override
497   public Set<K> keySet() {
498      return map.keySet();
499   }
500
501   @Override
502   public Collection<V> values() {
503      return map.values();
504   }
505
506   /**
507    * Adds an entry to this map with automatic type conversion.
508    *
509    * <p>
510    * This method converts the key and value using the configured key/value functions (if any) and validates
511    * the types (if key/value types were specified when creating the map). After conversion and validation,
512    * the entry is added using the standard {@link #put(Object, Object)} method, which applies the filter.
513    *
514    * <h5 class='section'>Type Conversion:</h5>
515    * <ul>
516    *    <li>If a key function is configured, the key is converted by applying the function
517    *    <li>If a value function is configured, the value is converted by applying the function
518    *    <li>If no function is configured, the object is used as-is (but may be validated if types were specified)
519    * </ul>
520    *
521    * <h5 class='section'>Type Validation:</h5>
522    * <ul>
523    *    <li>If key type was specified (via {@link #create(Class, Class)}), the converted key must be an instance of that type
524    *    <li>If value type was specified (via {@link #create(Class, Class)}), the converted value must be an instance of that type
525    *    <li>If {@link #create()} was used (no types specified), <c>Object.class</c> is used, which accepts any type
526    * </ul>
527    *
528    * <h5 class='section'>Return Value:</h5>
529    * <ul>
530    *    <li>If the entry is added successfully, returns the previous value associated with the key (or <jk>null</jk> if there was no mapping)
531    *    <li>If the entry is filtered out, returns <jk>null</jk> (even if there was a previous value)
532    * </ul>
533    *
534    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
535    * <p class='bjava'>
536    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
537    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
538    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
539    *       .valueFunction(o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString()))
540    *       .build();
541    *
542    *    <jv>map</jv>.add(<js>"key"</js>, <js>"123"</js>);  <jc>// Value converted from String to Integer</jc>
543    * </p>
544    *
545    * @param key The key to add. Will be converted if a key function is configured.
546    * @param value The value to add. Will be converted if a value function is configured.
547    * @return The previous value associated with the key if the entry was added, or <jk>null</jk> if there was no mapping or the entry was filtered out.
548    * @throws RuntimeException If conversion fails or type validation fails.
549    */
550   public V add(Object key, Object value) {
551      K convertedKey = convertKey(key);
552      V convertedValue = convertValue(value);
553      if (filter.test(convertedKey, convertedValue))
554         return put(convertedKey, convertedValue);
555      return null;  // Filtered out, return null
556   }
557
558   /**
559    * Adds all entries from the specified map with automatic type conversion.
560    *
561    * <p>
562    * This method iterates over all entries in the source map and adds each one using {@link #add(Object, Object)},
563    * which applies conversion and validation before adding.
564    *
565    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
566    * <p class='bjava'>
567    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
568    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
569    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
570    *       .valueFunction(o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString()))
571    *       .build();
572    *
573    *    Map&lt;String, String&gt; <jv>source</jv> = Map.of(<js>"a"</js>, <js>"5"</js>, <js>"b"</js>, <js>"-1"</js>);
574    *    <jv>map</jv>.addAll(<jv>source</jv>);  <jc>// Values converted, negative value filtered out</jc>
575    * </p>
576    *
577    * @param source The map containing entries to add. Can be <jk>null</jk> (no-op).
578    * @return This object for method chaining.
579    */
580   public FilteredMap<K,V> addAll(Map<?,?> source) {
581      if (source != null) {
582         for (var entry : source.entrySet()) {
583            add(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
584         }
585      }
586      return this;
587   }
588
589   /**
590    * Adds arbitrary values to this map.
591    *
592    * <p>
593    * Objects can be any of the following:
594    * <ul>
595    *    <li>Maps of key/value types convertible to the key/value types of this map.
596    * </ul>
597    *
598    * <p>
599    * Each entry from the maps will be added using {@link #add(Object, Object)}, which applies
600    * conversion and filtering.
601    *
602    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
603    * <p class='bjava'>
604    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
605    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
606    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
607    *       .build();
608    *
609    *    Map&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map1</jv> = Map.of(<js>"a"</js>, 5, <js>"b"</js>, -1);
610    *    Map&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map2</jv> = Map.of(<js>"c"</js>, 10);
611    *    <jv>map</jv>.addAny(<jv>map1</jv>, <jv>map2</jv>);  <jc>// Adds a=5, c=10 (b=-1 filtered out)</jc>
612    * </p>
613    *
614    * @param values The values to add. Can be <jk>null</jk> or contain <jk>null</jk> values (ignored).
615    * @return This object for method chaining.
616    */
617   public FilteredMap<K,V> addAny(Object...values) {
618      if (values != null) {
619         for (var o : values) {
620            if (o != null && o instanceof Map<?,?> m) {
621               addAll(m);
622            }
623         }
624      }
625      return this;
626   }
627
628   /**
629    * Adds a list of key/value pairs to this map.
630    *
631    * <p>
632    * The pairs are processed in order, with each pair consisting of two consecutive elements
633    * in the array. Each pair is added using {@link #add(Object, Object)}, which applies
634    * conversion and filtering.
635    *
636    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
637    * <p class='bjava'>
638    *    FilteredMap&lt;String, Integer&gt; <jv>map</jv> = FilteredMap
639    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
640    *       .filter((k, v) -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
641    *       .build();
642    *
643    *    <jv>map</jv>.addPairs(<js>"a"</js>, 5, <js>"b"</js>, -1, <js>"c"</js>, 10);
644    *    <jc>// Adds a=5, c=10 (b=-1 filtered out)</jc>
645    * </p>
646    *
647    * @param pairs The pairs to add. Must have an even number of elements.
648    * @return This object for method chaining.
649    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If an odd number of parameters is provided.
650    */
651   public FilteredMap<K,V> addPairs(Object...pairs) {
652      assertArgNotNull("pairs", pairs);
653      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
654         throw illegalArg("Odd number of parameters passed into addPairs()");
655      for (var i = 0; i < pairs.length; i += 2)
656         add(pairs[i], pairs[i + 1]);
657      return this;
658   }
659
660   private K convertKey(Object key) {
661      if (keyFunction != null) {
662         key = keyFunction.apply(key);
663      }
664      if (key == null) {
665         // Allow null for non-primitive types
666         if (keyType.isPrimitive())
667            throw rex("Cannot set null key for primitive type {0}", keyType.getName());
668         return null;
669      }
670      if (keyType.isInstance(key))
671         return keyType.cast(key);
672      throw rex("Object of type {0} could not be converted to key type {1}", cn(key), cn(keyType));
673   }
674
675   private V convertValue(Object value) {
676      if (valueFunction != null) {
677         value = valueFunction.apply(value);
678      }
679      if (value == null) {
680         // Allow null for non-primitive types
681         if (valueType.isPrimitive())
682            throw rex("Cannot set null value for primitive type {0}", valueType.getName());
683         return null;
684      }
685      if (valueType.isInstance(value))
686         return valueType.cast(value);
687      throw rex("Object of type {0} could not be converted to value type {1}", cn(value), cn(valueType));
688   }
689
690   @Override
691   public String toString() {
692      return map.toString();
693   }
694
695   @Override
696   public boolean equals(Object o) {
697      return map.equals(o);
698   }
699
700   @Override
701   public int hashCode() {
702      return map.hashCode();
703   }
704}
705
